::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**MT1.2 Muddy Shorelines**](/efg-info/MT1_2.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/MT1_2_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: MT1.2.IM.orig v1.0.

> Tidal flats were mapped directly from remote sensing time series and aggregated to 1 degree spatial resolution by Murray et al. (2019). Major occurrences were mapped in 1-degree cells with >200km2 mudflat extent, and minor occurrences were mapped in cells with 5-200km2 mudflat extent.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**TidalFlats2019** (Murray NJ et al. 2019):

Source of _modeled and validated distribution from remote sensors_.
 Resolution: <1km, time series.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (variable).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset        |url                                                                                                               |
|:--------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|TidalFlats2019 |<https://data.unep-wcmc.org/datasets/47>{target='links'} :: <https://www.intertidal.app/download>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Aggregation*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Fine quality map series*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,specific*.

Ground observations are _yes_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Quantitative accuracy assessment,documented,quantitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Web navigation (**code: MT1.2.web.map**, version v1.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: MT1.2.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**MT1.2.web.map** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MT1.2.web.map_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.MT1_2_web_map){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

**MT1.2.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MT1.2.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map have similar licenses, but please check the license information below.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
